subject: Re: Essay: The Trouble With JUnit
msgSnippet: ... Of ... What ... Umm ... Agile Java   by Jeff Langr?  Agile Java represents a successful approach to learning
messageBody:
> From: junit@yahoogroups.com [mailto:junit@yahoogroups.com] On Behalf
Of
> J. B. Rainsberger
> Sent: Friday, November 24, 2006 1:02 PM
> To: junit@yahoogroups.com
> Subject: Re: [junit] Essay: The Trouble With JUnit
>
> What if I told you that someone was working on a book that teaches
> object-oriented design /entirely/ through test-driven development?
What
> if I told you that such a book would likely have a Java version? Might
> that help?


Umm ... Agile Java <http://www.bookpool.com/sm/0131482394> by Jeff
Langr?

<quote>
Agile Java represents a successful approach to learning and mastering
Java development ... Using TDD, you will learn how to craft Java code to
produce solid object-oriented designs and highly maintainable, high
quality systems.
</quote>
